explanation: I only flagged calls to functions from <string.h> (strlen and memcpy) that appear in the provided code, because MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 specifically concerns use of those string.h functions and potential out-of-bounds accesses they might cause. Other potentially risky calls (e.g. snprintf usages) are not in <string.h> and thus are outside the strict scope of Rule 21.17; moreover, the snprintf calls in this code are followed by explicit length checks of their return values and available buffer space (checks of res and rdc->buf_len - rdc->off or sizeof(buffer)), and the dirname/fullname snprintf usages also check the return value against the destination size. There are no other calls to memcpy/memmove/memset/memcmp/strcpy/strncpy/strcat/strncat/strlen/strspn in the provided code, so no additional fragments need to be reported for Rule 21.17.
